title: NVIDIA Market Cap Surpasses $4 Trillion Amid AI Infrastructure Boom
summary: The chipmaker becomes the worlds most valuable company as demand for AI training hardware shows no signs of slowing.
content:
NVIDIA crossed the $4 trillion market capitalization threshold on Wednesday, overtaking Apple to become the most valuable publicly traded company in history.

The milestone reflects the enormous capital flowing into AI infrastructure. Every major tech company is racing to build massive GPU clusters, and NVIDIA controls roughly 80% of the AI training chip market.

CEO Jensen Huang announced plans for a new "Blackwell Ultra" chip architecture expected in Q3, promising 4x the inference performance of current H100 chips. "We are at the beginning of a new industrial revolution," Huang said at the companys GTC conference.

Analysts remain divided on whether the valuation is sustainable, with some drawing parallels to the dot-com bubble while others argue AI infrastructure spending is only accelerating.
